data.title: Who do you prefer: Joy Division or New Order
data.meta_description:
Do you prefer the ambient and angry Joy Division:


Or the electronic and emotional New Order:
data.text:
I honestly don't know New Order all that much beyond their radio singles despite being a huge Joy Division fan.

My favorite JD recordings are actually the BBC sessions.

Peel Sessions*

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Peel_Sessions_(Joy_Division)

And yeah, it's The Fuckin' Peel Sessions. Never a dull moment.

I like both but early New Order is pure genius.

"Age of Consent" is one of the best songs ever recorded. Bliss from opening note to closing.

Yeah, I think NO's first couple albums + Ceremony is like the perfect fusion between the two bands.

They both serve different purposes for me. New Order is, in my opinion, technically superior but I mostly use them for background music whereas I dance to Joy Division.

Not to say you couldn't interchange those two.

Both of them are two of my favorite bands, but I'm personally a bigger fan of New Order.

New Order.

Technique has a sound that I had been looking for for years.

Both are great though.

Best New Order album imo. Round & Round is too good.

New Order but it's completely unacceptable to pit them against each other and you know this

No, because different strokes for different folks. Some people maybe hate an incarnation they took and have a preference for the sound of the other.

Yeah, I think NO's first couple albums + Ceremony is like the perfect fusion between the two bands.

Agreed completely.

I used to occasionally play Age of & Disorder back to back when I ran a dance party in NYC.

I like both but early New Order is pure genius.

"Age of Consent" is one of the best songs ever recorded. Bliss from opening note to closing.

I agree with both especially the later, Age of Consent is GOAT tier.

I like both but early New Order is pure genius.

"Age of Consent" is one of the best songs ever recorded. Bliss from opening note to closing.

It's an amazing song, but jfc Bernard Sumner can be painful to listen to when he sings sometimes.

It's an amazing song, but jfc Bernard Sumner can be painful to listen to when he sings sometimes.

Oh really? He doesn't really bother me. I mean he's not a great singer but he was put there and seems to take a "well, someone's got to do it" approach to vocals.

Maybe we should rate the 999999 New Order side projects

-Electronic

-Revenge

-The Other Two

-Monaco

-Peter Hook & the Light

-I'm sure I'm forgetting like a dozen or two others

New Order are one of the best bands of the 1980s

But, despite their small catalogue, Joy Division are one of the all time greatest bands with two GOAT-tier albums (and great singles). Either way Peter Hook is the reason I learnt to play bass.

Oh really? He doesn't really bother me. I mean he's not a great singer but he was put there and seems to take a "well, someone's got to do it" approach to vocals.

Maybe we should rate the 999999 New Order side projects

-Electronic

-Revenge

-The Other Two

-Monaco

-Peter Hook & the Light

-I'm sure I'm forgetting like a dozen or two others

Electronic's debut album is fantastic. Tacky in the best way possible. Weird that this is the mix of New Order and The Smiths with that tinge of Pet Shop Boys. My favourite supergroup.

Electronic's debut album is fantastic. Tacky in the best way possible. Weird that this is the mix of New Order and The Smiths with that tinge of Pet Shop Boys. My favourite supergroup.

Love this song.

Joy Divison, but Ceremony is my favourite song of all time (even though I know it's one of the last songs the made with Ian). I have the first vinyl single pressing of it which sounds much more different than the versions you can find online on streaming services.

Electronic's debut album is fantastic. Tacky in the best way possible. Weird that this is the mix of New Order and The Smiths with that tinge of Pet Shop Boys. My favourite supergroup.

It is pretty good. Although they had some decent post-debut tunes too. I always loved "For You."

I always knew it as BBC because I've had this particular CD since I was a wee lad. But well, Peel championed so many amazing bands, it's mindblowing. Always some of their best recordings as well at this show.

That version of Colony is my favorite JD track.

Also, everyone:

Where do I start with New Order album-wise? What's commonly regarded as their best album?

Where do I start with New Order album-wise? What's commonly regarded as their best album?

Probably Movement or Substance (which is a compilation but it gives you an idea of what New Order is generally like)

Probably Movement or Substance (which is a compilation but it gives you an idea of what New Order is generally like)

I'm like 1:30 into Ceremony and it's already fucking good...oh boy. I know what I'm digging into this weekend.

I also have no idea why I've never really dug into New Order in all this time. I've been listening to JD for nearly 20 years.

New Order because there is so much more of it. Their discography goes through changes and evolutions since they actually had a career. I do love some Joy Division, though. I've never heard a voice quite like Ian Curtis.
